alert.note: Alert for Greene; Texas; Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 12:56AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Webster, Wright, southwestern Texas and Greene Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1256 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles northeast of Hartville to near Niangua to 7 miles east of Willard to near Walnut Grove. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Republic, Marshfield, Battlefield, Willard, Mountain Grove, Rogersville, Strafford, Cabool, Seymour, Ash Grove, Fair Grove, Mansfield, Fordland, Dawson, Walnut Grove, Norwood, Hartville, Niangua and Duncan. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 59 and 102. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Missouri.
